txt.en: Although their numbers have been diminished by your efforts at Azgh-buzru, the forces of Gorgar the Ruthless continue to muster at Bagûd-mekhem. Worse yet, hobgoblins and dragon-kind loyal to Hrímil Frost-heart have been allowed into Bagûd-mekhem as part of a tenuous alliance to stop the Gabil'akkâ from reaching Mount Gundabad.\n\nIf the Gabil'akkâ are to win a final foothold before the gates of Gundabad, their enemies at Bagûd-mekhem must be defeated to the last.
You have defeated a vast number of enemies at Bagûd-mekhem.
You have defeated a vast number of enemies at Bagûd-mekhem and dealt a grievous blow to the forces of both Gorgar the Ruthless and Hrímil Frost-heart.

Enemies can be found at Bagûd-mekhem.\n\nFoes loyal to both Gorgar the Ruthless and Hrímil Frost-heart have mustered at Bagûd-mekhem, the gate of winds. You should defeat them and aid the march on Gundabad.
As the War of Three Peaks rages on, the forces of Gorgar the Ruthless and Hrímil Frost-heart have forged a tenuous alliance at Bagûd-mekhem to put an end to the Gabil'akkâ's march on Gundabad.
